page.title: 11Interviewing Mill Employee 2
page.content: {Cotton was king in our area for many {years - in fact,it was the livelihood {of most of its inhabitants.Can you {remember changes taking place-and how {it affected our mills?}The big changes took place just after the war when Fothergill and Harveys started to experiment with different types of material especially glass.That was one of the first big moves that they made from cotton.{Why do you think {Fothergill and Harveys survived when {so many other mills closed down?} Well,very fortunalely,we had some far thinking men, especially Mr Charles Harvey and even Mrs Harvey, could see that cheaper cotton from other countries was begining to arrive so they started looking ahead to see what other types of fibres would be useful in the future.That is how Fothergill & Harveys have survived up till now.
